summary.description: De novo transcriptome assembler for RNA-Seq data. It uses RNA-Seq reads as input in fasta or fastq format, outputs all transcripts in fasta format, without using a reference genome. It works in two steps: First, Bridger partitions the sequence data into many individual splicing graphs, each capturing the full transcriptional complexity at a given gene or no more than a few genes. Then, it uses a rigorous mathematical model called minimum path cover to search an optimal set of paths.
summary.name: Bridger
